findings.title: Improved Logic of Amount Calculation In withdraw()
findings.description: The `amount` variable inside the `withdraw()` routine is not properly adjusted when the investor gives a larger input value of `exact` than `_raisedBalance`, causing the transaction to revert.

findings.title: Generation of Meaningful Events For Important State Changes
findings.description: The `Pool` contract lacks emitting important events to reflect updates of `_supplyOnInvestorLevels`, `_whitelistOnInvestorLevels`, `_tokenDecimal`, `_acceptingTokenContract` and `_acceptingTokenDecimal` in the `initialize()` function.

findings.title: 3.3 Incompatibility With Deflationary Tokens
findings.description: The `Pool` contract allows users to invest ERC20 tokens but is incompatible with deflationary tokens.

findings.title: Reentrancy Risk in Pool::invest()
findings.description: The invest() function in the Pool contract violates the checks-effects-interactions principle, making it vulnerable to re-entrancy attacks.
